title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message
OB: When the user tries to invoke the New Java Package feature, a message appears before any input in the package name field. The message states: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.' However, the package name field is empty at this point.
EB: The user expects that there should be no error message when the package name field is empty, and the 'Finish' button should be disabled. The message should be clear and should not cause confusion. If the message is indeed an error, it should be displayed in red with an error icon.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new Java Project.
2. Select the project.
3. Try to invoke the New Java Package feature.
